text: these aren't bugs they're robots more
precisely kilobots
they may seem like something straight
out of wall-e but they're real and by
working together these simple machines
can do amazing things scientists at
Harvard modeled the kilobots programming
on nature specifically a phenomenon
called emergent behavior that science
speak for hive mind it's what allows
termites bees and ants to perform
complex operations without any leader or
centralized coordination just taking
cues from their neighbor and adapting
South African termite colonies build
amazing 25-foot air-conditioned
structures army ants form themselves
into attack columns and even bridges all
based on a collective brain to replicate
this hive mind programmers use infrared
light to give one pre-programmed
instruction to the group like build a
star the kilobots then use tiny
transmitters to bounce light signals off
the floor to each other relay
information about distance in progress
which allows the swarm to self-organize
with shocking efficiency for now
kilobots must be built and programmed by
man but it's projected that swarm
intelligence will ultimately be able to
replicate itself that could
revolutionize search and rescue mining
environmental cleanup space exploration
and medicine imagine robots building you
an airfield mapping caves or even curing
cancer
you
